Minka are traditional houses and private residences of farmers, artisans, and merchants ==Types== There are several types or styles of minka, including * Semi-buried huts (tate-ana jūkyo) * Wooden houses with roofs of thatching (kayabunki), wood shingles (ishitori) or tiles (kawarabuki) * Shops and warehouses (dozō, kura) ==References== ==Other websites== * Japanese Architecture and Art Net Users System (JAANUS), minka 民家 Category:Buildings and structures in Japan
